text:
F: huge, tan, good retention.
C: dark, opaque.
A: malty, chocolate, cocoa, raisins, candy sugar, fruity, yeast.
T: malty, dark fruits, chocolate, molasses, fruity, candy sugar, dark cherries, yeasty, light vinous, bit of nut, full body, medium to high carbonation, taste is amazing, fully enjoyed, 75cl bottle from abbey monastery.
Soaked grapes and raisins, slight alcohol tones. Opaque murky brown quad colour with excellent pillowy head. Carbonated watery body, with dark fruits. Great quad.
330 ml Bottle at home. Not a bad beer, but I was expecting a little bit more from a trappist beer, but very drinkable. Redish with sherry notes

Robe brune dense, fine mousse crémeuse. Nez puissant sur des notes chocolatées, vineuse, pointe de caramel, fourrure, malt torréfié, noisette. Bouche à lattaque ample, riche, puissante, tout en restant tendue et digeste, longue finale puissante. Une bière dhiver à siroter au coin du feu.

Shared 750 ml. bottle poured to a snifter displaying a darkest brown hue, with a persistent & frothy layer of off white/light tan head foam, and equally lasting dots & dashes of lacing. The nose was dark, dried fruit, a bit of malty sweetness, a touch of roastiness, and holiday pudding-like spice. Medium+ bodied, with lively carbonation, the taste was similar notes, some tartness & tanginess, low earthy bitterness, and pleasant booziness into the finish. An exceptional Quad.

Bottle. Pours clear, dark brown, with no head. Aroma has notes of yeast, and sweet malts with wood. Medium to full body, with soft carbonation. Flavour follows suit, with wooden yeast and sweet malts. A bit bland, and somewhat of a disappointment. Probably some years too old.
Beige head with perfect brussels lace. Aroma: malts, prunes and caramel. Taste: nuts, hazelnut, caramel, dark fruits and liquor. Tasted in Olut Club de Cata

0.7 l bottle shared. Apperance: A allmost clear dark ruby to brown with a medium large, frothy but stable, slightly creamy, beige head.
Aroma: Malts, dark fruits(rasisin,prunes, berries) , caramel, spicey yeast. slightly Taste: Sweetish, malts, dark fruits like the aroma,caramel and some spicey yeast to make it work traces of cocoa,clove with a beyond average light bitter finish. with some vinous and warming-alcohol.. Medium body, lively carbonation. 
Nice and tasty complex beer and better then expected.

Bottle at home, 27th December 16. Found this at the back of the collection, BBE July 2016. Pours copper coloured, a white head, good lacing. Aroma is molasses, dark fruit, liquor. Taste is caramel, molasses, fig, raisins soaked in booze, its sweet, but there is a bitterness to temper this. Nice to sip by the fire.

UPDATED: DEC 26, 2016 0.75 l bottle from Belgiuminabox.com, best before July 2016, so I guess about two and a half years old. Clear, very dark ruby to brown with a medium large, frothy, slightly creamy, stable, beige head. Sweetish-malty, slightly fruity and a bit yeasty-spicy aroma of caramel, raisins, prunes, blackcurrant and a touch of clove. Rather sweet, malty, slightly fruity and a bit yeasty-spicy taste of caramel, candy sugar, raisins, prunes, blackcurrant and some cocoa as well as hints of coconut and clove, followed by a medium long, slightly bitter, moderately yeasty-spicy, vinous and a bit warming-alcoholic finish. Medium body, rather effervescent mouthfeel, lively carbonation. Rich, satisfying and very tasty beer!

Grote fles gekocht bij de bron. Bruin bier, de kraag blijft lang als een laagje op het bier. Aroma: mout, caramel, rozijnen, zoetig. Smaak: beter als het bier opwarmt, kandij zoetig, licht caramel. Solide spul.
Club Cata Olut. Envejecida 3 años. Color tostado. Aroma caramelo , regaliz. Dulce en boca.

Beautiful dark brown pour with strong stable head. A: yeast, plum, faint chocolate, malts, buttermilk, more spicy than normal Achel. T: first sip is metallic and malts. Next sips are sweet but robust, sweet maltiness, nice dark fruit lacing, vanilla and light choco. Light spicy, faintly boozy development, with nutmeg note. Finish is quite bitter, but never too much. Robust, very nice.

Piana obfita, kremowo żółta, drobno i średnio pęcherzykowa, długo obecna w postaci mięsistej pierzynki. Barwa rubinowo miedziana, lekko opalizująca. Aromat przyjemny, sporo tu rodzynek, daktyli, karmelu, suszonych śliwek i gruszek oraz bliżej nieokreślonych ziół czy przypraw. W smaku jest fajna owocowo likierowa słodycz, ciemne dojrzałe winogrona, morele kandyzowane, figi, melasa, karmel, pikantne przyprawy... Lekka ziołowa goryczka i dość wysokie nagazowanie fajnie balansują wyklejającą i treściwą całość.

Niezwykle udany trunek, fajnie wyważony, intensywny i z precyzyjnie wkomponowanym, delikatnie rozgrzewającym dopiero na żołądku, alkoholem. Zasłużone top 10 quadów...

UPDATED: AUG 21, 2016 Bottle 750ml. Served at cellar temperature. Pours a hazy burnt copper with a ruby tint. Head is beige, large, foamy and mostly lasting. Aroma has notes of red wine and woody/leafy hops; dark cherries,caramelized prunes, lightly toasted wholemeal bread, Belgian candy sugar, caramel, allspice and hints of aniseed balls (red). Flavour is extremely complex and slightly vinous; light herb-like bitterness, lightly toasted brown bread, dark plums (strong), blackcurrants, raspberry licorice, cooked brown sugar, allspice, a dash of ruby port and dried-leaf/wood notes in the finish. Full bodied with a slightly oily texture, medium carbonation and an incredibly long, complex finish. ABV is very well hidden. A truly SUPERB Belgian Quadruple!
Bottle, 750 ml from Svijet Piva. Shared with JFK10000 and Miro. Pours brown with an off-white head. Sweet, malty, dried fruit, caramel, yeast, candy sugar. Medium+ bodied. Good.
Bottle 0,75ltr: Dark brown colored brew with an fine sweet bitter taste with some warming up abbilities. Hints of caramel, dried fruit and spices. Bought it at the source.

Ulkonäöltään pitkälle Achel Bruinin oloinen. Onhan tämä vaan kaunis olut. Kaatuu omaan nimikkolasiinsa vaahdoten runsaasti alusta alkaen. Kun olut on kokonaan lasissa, on näkymä silmiä hivelevä. Syvän tummanruskeaa, sopivassa valossa rubiininpunaista kirkasta olutta paksulla kermaisen kuohkealla ja kumpuilevalla kahden sentin vaaleanbeigellä vaahtokerroksella, joka ylettyy juuri lasin yläreunan tasolle. Vaahto on vieläpä todella pitkäkestoista ja runsaasti pitsiä jättävää. Tuoksussa kypsää hedelmäisyyttä, luumua ja rusinaa, hiivaa sekä vahvasti yrttistä mausteisuutta ja tummaa marjaisuutta. Olutta suuhun kaataessa ensimmäisenä hiipii mieleen samettinen koko suun täyttävä pehmeys. Muutoin maku on tumman hedelmäinen, luumuinen, makean maltainen ja yrttisen mausteinen sekä tumman marjainen. Jälkimaultaan pehmeän mausteinen olut; mausteisuus tuntuu suussa pitkään. Suutuntuma melko täyteläinen ja pehmeä. Satumaisen kaunis ja samettisen pehmeä laatutuote Belgiasta.

Bottle, 75cL. @Naintré with my dad. A very dark brown, nearly black beer, with a big beige foamy head ; good retention. Roast, light caramel, light red berries, light biscuit. Medium sweet, round and warming, light dry bitter, light fresh wind ; good balance. Full body, light silky texture, average good carbonation, sweet biscuit medium lasting finish. Overall, a great strong brown belgian ale ; gourmet !

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 butelka 0.75 do 8 lipca 2017. dosc duza, szybko opadajaca, kromowa piana, zostaje cienkim korzyszkiem, brudzi szklo. samo piwo dosc jasne, taka sredni ozaparzona herbata zrubinowymi refleksami. Aromaty dosc intensywne, rodzynki, ciemne, suszone owoce, karmel (cukier trzcinowy podpalany jak na niektorych ciastach?), migdaly... w tle jeszcz ejakie snutki, ktore nie sa juz tak jednoznaczne, i zaledwie gdzies tam przewijaja sie bardzo delikatnie, ale np czasem mam wrazenie orzechow, czasem jakiejs kawy nawet,,. niekiedy swieze jasne owoce a la banan, brzoskwinia. W ustach pierwsze zaskoczenie: to piwo jest lekkie. Ciala nie ma wiele (choc ani troche nie jest wodniste), nie jest ulepkowate, nie ma syropowych konotacji w konsystencji. Po prostu jest lekkie. Jeszcze raz: nie mylic z wodniste (chocby dlatego, ze jest intesywne). Stanowczo w slodka strone, ale nie jakos bardzo mocno. generalnie w ustach raczej adekwatnie, do tego co nos wyczul. goryczki bardzo malo, alko bardzo ladnie ukryte, wysycenie srednie. calosc raczej z jednej strony nie daje wrazenia, ktore sklanialoby do glosnych okrzykow, ale w caloksztalcie jest bardzo pijalne, bardzo mile w odbiorze, bardzo ladnie wywazone... kurcze, nie wiem, co z czym jest wywazone, bo de facto niemal tu nie ma chmieli na ten przyklad ;) ale z wlasnymi wrazeniami czy odczuciami ciezko sie polemizuje. Jest to tez najlatwiej przyswajalny i najszybciej z pokala znikajacy quad jaki mi wpada teraz do glowy. Tego sie nie kosztuje, to sie pije :) - 4.2 Rami Rami is drinking an Achel Extra Bruin (De 3 Wijzen) (2015) by Brouwerij der Sint-Benedictusabdij de Achelse Kluis at Muzeum Azji i PacyfikuJakas mniej udana butla, chleb, karmel, troche owocow, slodkie, sa wciaz jakies fuzle meczace... niehalo jak na to piwo - 3.6ocena moze nie tyle usredniona, ale obnizona za wpadke za drugim razem: 4.0Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

UPDATED: JUN 8, 2016 Trade with BenBreeg. In Teku glass. At dinner, with noodles soup + brastwurst, and watching Adele?s Life. Very tasty dark fruits brew. Alcohol well hidden and very pleasant feeling. Just a bit less amazing than a Westy 12

Aroma: sour fruits, similar to regular Achel Bruin.
Taste: sweet and less sour then regular Bruin.
Flavour: dried cherries, cherry liqueur, spiced wine.
More dry and alcoholic then Achel Bruin.

Good.
Bottle @ home. Gushing all around. Dark brown colour, beige foam. Sour and infected beer. Very disappointed, maybe a bad bottle? Will rerate on a next occasion.
Trübes orange braunes Bier mit einer mittelgroßen beigen Schaumkrone. Geruch nach dunklem Malz, reife Früchte, Obst, Karamell. Geschmack leicht röstmalzig, Karamell, reifes Obst, leicht alkoholisch.
From a bottle into snifter. Brown body with tan head. Brown sugar, banana, sweet, long finish with dark fruit.

Ha un bel colore tonaca di frate con riflessi ramati, leggermente velata; un cappello di schiuma considerevole, beige, a grana fine e di lunga persistenza. Il naso è caramelloso, sciropposo, con note brillanti di liquirizia, malto e cioccolato, e la frutta rossa (susine, ciliegie) in netta evidenza. Anche lo speziato, nel naso come al palato, si fa apprezzare, in un corpo robusto, strutturato e caldo: è avvolgente il tutto, con lalcool non aggressivo e un sentore di barrique, insieme alla vaniglia, allo zucchero candito e ai chiodi di garofano. Il retrogusto è leggermente maltato e amarognolo, in una corsa finale lunga ed equilibrata.

0.75 L bottle shared with kapusil; brown colour with minimal beige-ish head; aroma of caramel, biscuit and dried fruity notes, hints of herbs and miniml chocolate; taste is the same with earthy notes; correct quadrupel
0.75l bottle thanks to Lore. Reddish dark brown body, beige head. Aroma of banana, caramel, cocoa and nutmeg. Taste of caramel, cocoa, floral hops and orange zest. Nice one.

Bottle 0.75l at home, Nivala. BBE July 2016. Colour is brown with large slightly brownish white head. Aromas and flavours: Dark fruits, dry fruits, dryness, Belgian yeast and malts. Very carbonated. Soft and some warming.

750ml bottle (thanks Mart). Dark brown color. Huge size, brown head, stays. Acetone, vegetables, dirty, plastic, alcohol in aroma. Metallic, sweet, roast, caramel, alcohol in taste. Dirty cloth in aftertaste. Medium carbonation. Fine dust of yeast on tongue. Messy brew.

Dark brown beer, tan head. Nose is dark malt and sweet overripe fruit, berry notes, metallic hints and mild boiled turnip. Flavor is malty, toasty, caramel, dried fruit. Caramel and dark fruit in the finish, more metallic notes, yeast. Surprisingly light-bodied. Hides the ABV pretty well. Lingering dryness.

Bottle (from firma bier). Pours dark ruby-brown with light beige head. The head stays. Aroma is fresh fruits, esthers, malt, alcohol. Flavor is sweet and malty, dark fruits, plums, some alcohol. Finish is dry bitter. Overall: very good, but would like to try aged version.

Bottle shared at THT. Slight hazy brown with small light brown head. Light veggies, old coffee, caramel, stale malts, light dried berries, cardboard, fake chocolate. Medium sweet with light oxidized bitter notes. Over medium bodied. Wow, this is quite the let down, I expected way more of this.

Bottle shared at the return of Old Spice tasting. Pours very hazy brown with a medium tan head. Aroma of yeast, toffee, vegetal notes, compost and overripe dark fruits. Flavour is over moderate sweet and light moderate bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation. Disappointed with this beer, I really expected more.

Bottle at the Return of Old Spice tasting, Dec 2015, Den Haag. Poured a murky medium brown with a frothy white head. The aroma is yeast, sweet malt. The flavour is moderate sweet with a yeasty, light marzipan, dry fruit palate. Medium to light bodied with lively carbonation and a bubbly mouthfeel. I expected better.

UPDATED: DEC 5, 2015 75cl bottle shared at December THT.
Thick creamy tan head. very hazy amber pour. Decent

Appearance: Very dark brown, some tan head.
Aroma: Dark malt, dark fruit.
Taste: Dark malt, caramel sweetness, some dark fruits and chocolate too. Very nice!
Bought: Saveur-Biere.com, 750 ml, 8.40
Info: 14/11-2015, 62/100, BB: 31/1-2017

Donkerbruin bier met mooie beige schuimkraag.
Intens fruitige ester met gisttoets en zoethout op de achtergrond.
Zoete mout in de mond met droptoets.
Kruidige afdronk met hoppig eind.

Bottle @ home. Hazed mahogany pour with a tall tan head. Rich dark fruits and banana bread at first. Really intense carbonation kind of detracts from the enjoyment and theres a bit of a yeasty, mineral quality to it as well. Lots of caramel, toasted bread, and some roasted malts. Really strong fig and plum skin qualities. Slight alcohol on the finish as well. Good, but not amazing, unfortunately.

Bottle @ home. marrone, riflessi ambrati, velata. Schiuma beige, fine, non molto persistente. Aroma intenso fruttato, esteri del lievito, frutta candita, caramello, liquirizia, vaniglia. gusto dolce abboccato ai limiti dell amabile lingresso, tostato con la liquirizia in evidenza, lievemente metallica. Finale erbaceo amaro da luppolo. corpo medio/leggero carbonatazione decisa, calda, ma non alcolica. Grande equilibrio. Armonica.

Bottle at de garrebig opaque brown beer with beige head collapsing to lacingrich candy sugar and light cocoa on nose, full bodied, warming, demerara sugar, prunes, booze soaked rasins, not alcoholic, fruity finish

30/08/2015 @home 75cl bottle from Achelse Kluis.
Brown colour, big white head, nice carbonation. Nose is dark malts, caramel, fruits, Taste is dark malts, fruits, caramel, some chocolate, praline. Reminded me of the Chimay Bleu and I liked it the same.

750ml bottle enjoyed @ a friends cottage. Pours dark brown with a creamy and long lasting beige head, lots of floaties. Aroma is raisins, plums, prunes, figs, yeast and caramel. Flavour is medium sweet. Full bodied, creamy texture, soft carbonation. Finish is dark dried fruits, alcohol and a little sweet.
UPDATED: AUG 30, 2015 bottle from plonk. malty estery brown. mildly sweet but medium dry finish. High carbonation and warming alcohol. superb.

BOTTLE 75 CL. Hazy red-brown, small beige head. Spicy aroma - something between clove and lemon zest, with lots of harsh alcohol. Taste harsh, young and alcoholic. Disappointing, just like the regular Bruin.
Coppery colored pour. Close to toffee. Big off white head. Lots of lacing. Nose is molasses-y and sugar with some dark fruit. Taste is sweet sugar. Better quads out there for sure.
75cl bottle from cerveteca. Color is dark brown red. Thin to medium brown persistent head. Body is medium. Finish is long. Aroma is smokey, chocolate, malt, fruity, roasted, woody, mushrooms.

Flaska 75cl berggrens källare motala. Grumlig brunkopparfärgad. Söt och jästig doft med knäck och lite bananskum. Söt och lätt klibbig doft med bränt socker, torkad frukt och äpplekart. Fin avrundning i smaken
Bottle from Saveur Bière. Big frothy, beige head. Rusty body. Smells sweet, apple, plums, wheat, yeast, raisins. Tastes fruity, plums, apple, citrus. Sweet and fresh, bitter aftertaste.
Brown liquid with red shining. Large head. Aroma of malt. Medium body, average carbonation. Taste is bitter and sweet.

UPDATED: JAN 31, 2016 For sour one of the best Trappist Beers.Except Westvleteren 12.Dark amber colour medium sized foamy head. Alcohol and plum in aroma with hints of caramel. Caramel, raisins, plum and a bit yeast.
The only thing i hate it is the bottle. Does not have a cork.
Size big bottle. Dark Brown, hazy With a lightbrown head. Aroma of dark fruits and maltn. Light bittersweet taste With a Nice soft warm dark fruits end. Tasted late night ......one night
Smells good lot like other quadrupel look Ruby to dark Brown or black pleasant bitterness yeast flavor Nice mouthfeel a good beer

UPDATED: MAR 17, 2017 0,75l bottle @ Stadin Panimobaari. Pours hazy brown with a medium off-white head. Aroma is brown grainy malts. Flavor is deep grainy malts, alcohol and some hops. Great. (648415)
(170317) Re-rate, bottle @ Alko press tasting. Much more complex. Raisins and alcohol in the aroma. Raisins in the flavor too. Superb.

Smell with caramel, brown sugar, hop, color in dark red brown, clear with somewhat thick cream crown when pouring, taste of good amount of air, not too carbonated, right bitterness, sweet, malty, little sour, little tannin but long lasting. Right texture. Very good over all

Great appearance with a huge foamy, tan, long lasting head, plenty of lace, and a slightly hazy, brown amber color. Aroma is figs, dates, raisins, malt, toffee, caramel. Flavor is sweet up front then the aroma characteristics, then a few odd tastes. Body is good. Finish has those odd tastes along with some residual sweetness giving it a medicinal cast. But overall, very good.

Starts very straightforward quady, feels way too simple. After some time aroma opens up some delicate fruitiness. nice malty background all the way, caramel, dried fruits, plums, dark fruits, light berry note. Bit too high carbo for my liking. Mostly sweetish with some bitterness.
Light side quad, yet smooth and quite enjoyable
Brown cloudy with small beige head. Fruit (plums) aroma. Sweet sour fruity taste (dried plums, raisins) followed by good bitterness. Bitter and sweet malt aftertaste.
Weak aroma, very cloudy - like a dirty lake. Bitter but mild taste. Overall, good.
A lot of molasses, caramel and intense and bit very mice sour bacteria. Too carbonated. Taste is bit dissapointment, too plane. Bit wood and caramel.
Bottle. Muddy brown colour with fluffy beige head. Aroma is fruity of dried berries and prune, with smooth flavour of caramel and hops, nice warming mouth feels and smooth finish.
German yeasts, chocolate, anise. Alcohol is well-hidden. Nice beer but not the best trappist.

750 ml bottle
Deep ruby red brown beer. Clear first, hazy with sediment. Big blonde head. Aroma has cream fudge, herbs, earth and chocolate. Flavor has toffee, herbs, licorice and yeast. Palate is quite full and foaming. Finish has quite mild bitterness and heat of alcohol. Aftertaste feels a bit watery. Adding the sediment adds some cherriness. Cannot detect strong Belgian yeast characters, weird. I was expecting more.

Ölföreningens julölsprovning 2014. Flaska från 2012. Smak och doft torkad frukt så som dadlar, russin, plommon, jäst, farinsocker, marsipan, inlagda övermogna päron. Fin sötma, rund och len, fin beska. Mmm!

Stronger version of Achel 8 Bruin, originally marketed as Achel Drie Wijzen, since then more widely available as Achel Extra Bruin in 75 cl bottles. Deep mahogany colour with egg-white, medium, frothy head. Lovely aroma of raisins, brown sugar, brown bread, caramel, apple sauce, cinnamon, gingerbread, port wine, banana; sweet fruity onset, apple and banana, candi sugar touch, soft, full and velvety mouthfeel, sourish accent, yeasty spiciness, caramelly and somewhat chocolatey, rich maltiness, leafy but well balancing hop bitterishness and warming alcohol touch. Breathes the quality stamp of trappist ales, perhaps more so than the other Achels.

Bottle at the Cads 10th Anniversary bash, 29/03/15.
Clear amber/chestnut brown topped with moderate off white spotting.
Nose is toffee, rich malt, nutty, candied fruit peel, brown sugar, light must, dates.
Taste comprises sweet malt notes, toffee, yeast notes, dates, prunes, spice.
Medium + body, soft carbonation, sweet licks and booze in the close.
Ok quad.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle shared at the Cads 10th Anniversary Tasting - CBC Clerkenwell, London. Thanks to whomever brought this one! Pours clear ruby with a creamy tan head. Doughy brown bread in the nose, dark fruits, subtle brown sugar, yeast. Medium to big sweet flavor with lots of bready malts, toast, candi sugars, berries. Full bodied with average carbonation and creamy texture. Sweet and warming on the finish, with lots more rich brown bread, candi sugar, berries, toffee. Classic. Excellent. (March 2015, Score 4.0)Earlier Rating: 3/3/2012 Total Score: 4.2Bottle at the RBESG 2011 Grand Tasting, London. Pours hazy brown with a light, filmy head. Brown sugar malt aroma. Very sweet flavor, big malt notes, more brown sugar. Full bodied with fine to average carbonation and a very smooth mouthfeel. Mild warmth in the finish, with rope fruits, a bit of yeast, and more dark malt character. Good complexity and very drinkable. (August 2011, score 4.2)

Az "extra" jelző ez esetben kivételes tartalmat sejtet, azt pedig már a kitöltést követően megállapíthatjuk, mennyire lenyűgöző teremtmény ez a trappista remekmű. Eszpresszó habjánál krémesebb dolog kevés létezik, puha paplanként terül szét a gesztenyeszínű testen. Szinte unalomig ismert az élmények körvonala, parfümös intenzitással előtörő rágógumis, selyemcukros, elegáns karakterű élesztőtől fűtött aromáival mégis lehetetlenség betelni, miután mindegyik legendás palack másféle stílusban adja elő a cifra mondanivalót. Megnyugvást áraszt minden egyes molekulája, a végletekig kifinomult illatokhoz kevesen tudnának felzárkózni ízben, a főzet azonban lenyűgöző természetességgel vesz minden akadályt. Könnyed és légies kortyai súlyos tartalommal telítettek, a jó öreg aszalványok, a mézcseppekkel gazdagított fanyar élesztő harsogó képe, a nemes és érett, száraz alkoholok jegyei maradandó kombinációja által pillanatok alatt egy autentikus belga söröspince atmoszféráját szimatolhatjuk meg; nem valószínű, hogy jelentős számú vetélytársa akad a kategórián belül.

Bottle shared at the Cads 10 year celebration at CBC Clerkenwell. BB Jan 2015, 9.5%. Dark reddy brown, still, small tan head. Aroma is is caramel, toffee, dates. Body is medium, foamy, low carbonation. Taste is dark biscuity malts, rye bread, toffee, tangy fruits, dry and boozy. Classic Belgian stuff. Good.

Dark brown, almost pitch black. Long-lasting thick beige head.
Very intense on the nose: black wild berries, liquorice, caramel, maple syrup.
Very powerful. Sweet beggining, mouth covering developing, long ending without bitterness. Fantastic.

UPDATED: MAR 29, 2015 Achel Trappist Extra Bruin, uitgeschonken in Chimay bokaal, schuim komt meteen uit de fles na openen, beetje te uitbundige carbonatie? Diep donkerbruin ondoorzichtig bier, met donker beige schuimkraag die lange tijd stabiel blijft. Aangename geur van Belgische gist en veel gedroogd fruit, rozijnen, pruimen en vijgen. De smaak volgt de geur, met complexe en zachte smaken. Tonen van rozijnen, vijgen, pruimen, rode wijn, karamel, vers brood, speculaas, pure chocolade en zachte specerijen als vanille, kaneel en kardemom met een mooie finish van bittere hopsoorten. De afdronk is vrij lang met aangenaam bittere hoptonen. Dit is een mooi gebalanceerde quadrupel van de Achelse Kluis. Absoluut het beste bier van deze brouwerij, deze Trappist behoort ook tot de beste en meer complexe trappist bieren die er zijn, met ook smaakelementen van de beroemde Westvleteren bieren. Deze Achel Extra Bruin is niet overal verkrijgbaar, maar is  zeker een Trappist die je als liefhebber moet hebben geproefd.
Donkerbruin tot zwart bier met schuim. Smaak is hoppig bitter, caramel, chokolade. Smaak blijft lang hangen.

UPDATED: AUG 14, 2015 750cc bottle. Dark brown with creamy persistent head. Outstanding beer. It tastes "trappist" but very balanced. Everything just feels in its place. Raisin, figs, caramel, dark fruits, lots of candi and some spice and floral notes from the hops in the back. Nice alcohol warmth but highly drinkable.

2015/01/27 - Pours a dark amber colour with a thick, foamy, khaki head that lingers and leaves moderate lacing. Aroma is dates, figs, mildly sour cherries, candied sugar, yeast and caramel. Taste is moderately sweet dates and figs, followed by slightly sour cherries and a mildly drying, warming finish. Have wanted to try this for a while now. Not the best quad I have ever had, but it's right up there. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Top di gamma di Achel!! Una meraviglia di quadrupel. Bel colore con riflessi ramati, bella schiuma beige di lunga persistenza. Al naso salgono sentori di caramello con note di liquirizia e frutti rossi. Il gusto è zuccheroso, giusto equilibrio con lalcol!! Veramente una gran bella bevuta!

Appearance an excellent deep brown with nice lacing and frothy 1 finger head.  Aroma is pleasant- mix of malts, sweet caramel and perhaps chocolate. Bouteille de 75 cl simplement capsulée (et non bouchonnée) : très curieux pour ce 
niveau de bière, puisque nous sommes avec une brune supérieure de 9,5 % abv.
Cette bière est ainsi une quadruple non bouchonnée... Imaginons cela avec la Chimay bleue !!!
Mon exemplaire était à date en fin 2011, et la bière est complètement plate au versage.
La couleur est passée au brun roux du porto tawny, ce qui nest pas du meilleur effet mais on
peut comprendre.
Clarté nette. Bulles et mousse inexistantes.
Arômes de pruneau, malt, figue, poires cuites.
1ère bouche où on est parti sur le porto, il ny avait donc pas que la couleur !!
Puis on a vraiment la traduction ici de lexpression « pain liquide », on a un mélange malté
fort qui rend compte des céréales. Cest aussi pour moi un vrai « barley wine » parce que
limpression du vin plat est bien là, et il sagit donc bien dun vin dorge 
2ème bouche sur le pruneau, les fruits mûrs, le candi et une légère pointe de moka.
3ème bouche complète, avec une toute légère nuance de fraise mûre des variétés non sucrées.
Arrière-bouche pleine sur le malt et la levure, et une pointe de tourbe.
La longueur montre ce quest une madérisation pure, parfaite, jusquà la teinte tirant sur la
brique, avec en conséquence bien sûr une ampleur des saveurs.
La levure est intègre, un pur terreau...
Lalcool sest développé avec le temps, et tape sévèrement en début de dégustation. 
Il convient donc dinstaller cette dégustation dans le calme pour savourer pleinement ce
pur produit des forges de Vulcain... surtout sil est âgé.
La finale se laisse savourer car elle est complexe avec du bois, des fruits, du malt, de la 
levure et bien dautres choses qui relèvent du barley wine.
Une bière qui vous fait pénétrer dans les liens entre le vin et la bière, ce qui est un programme
fabuleux qui a lui seul mérite un très high score...
A déguster donc jeune pour le plaisir et âgée pour lérudition....

Bottle 75 cl, BBE 05/2016. Pours murky brown in color with small bubbly head. Ripe, very fruity plums and brown sugary sweetness in aroma. Flavor has similar aspects, with some additional vinous and just a bit of them bready notes as well having a gathering here. Sweet and slightly vinous notes with some dark bready notes in finish. Ripe fruity aftertaste with them vinous notes as well.

.75 bottle. Dark brown murky. Overripe fruits- apples, plums, even some banana. Good bitterness though, doesnt feel too sweet or tacky. Good dark candi, yeast flavours. Very tasty abbey dark ale. Intense flavours, well balanced.-- bb/h(n9)

UPDATED: FEB 7, 2014 75cl bottle. Shared with Mathieu87.
Appearance: lots of foam, dark-black beer, stable head.
Nose: burned malts, caramel, port.
Taste: burned malts, rather sweet aftertaste.

Bottle 750ml in Martins Fairview. Popped open and straight away a burst of brown sugar, dark fruits and nuts..oh could sniff this all day. Dark brown colour with thin white head. 
Taste is sweet, with flavours of caramel, dark fruits, roasted apples with a lovely warming feeling. Alcohol is well hidden. Top top beer.
This review is exported from olutopas.info with no comment. Original rating date  4.12.2009
Superlative. Excellent on all counts, prunes, toffee, some malt, some vanilla. A bare hint of the alcohol, not in flavor, but in warmth. A real gem.
This one has sweet caramel tones and typical dried fruit flavour. Good, will try again.

UPDATED: JUN 1, 2013 Dark brown with white head. Aroma is floral, belgian sugars and malt. Very rich! Taste is syrupy malt. Medium carbonation going on here. Palate is nice - appley tart. Nothing on the other trappist quads, but still a tasty big beer.

75cl bottle from Belgiuminabox,shared with Steve.Dark brown coloured pour with a medium sized off white head which soon reduced.Lovely aromas of malt,caramel,dried fruit,brown sugar and herbs all of which came through in the taste.Also toffee and molasses with some yeast touches detected by the second or third sip.With the alcohol in the background and a well balanced mix of flavours we both enjoyed this one very much.Tasty beer.
Pours dark brown with a good off-white head. Aroma is rich, nutty and sweet. Taste is very sweet: caramel, brown sugar. Creamy.Sweetness too much initially, but this beers quickly grows on you.

750 ml bottle into chalice, best before May 2013.  Pours hazy very dark reddish brown color with a nice 1 finger dense cream colored head with good retention, that reduces to a thin cap that lingers.  Nice spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass. Bottle from Bruisin Ales in Asheville. Pours cloudy copper brown. Beige head. Nose of dried apples, raisins, figs, prunes, candied sugar, and delicate yeast. Taste is sweet and malty, but not cloying, and complexified by the great yeast. Dry, soft but full palate. Great.

Bottle at sampling session. 2005 vintage. From notes. Sweetish coffee nose, with something like shellac and candi sugar. Maybe a touch oxidized. Very pleasant dark fruitiness. Very long finish. Perhaps a little long in the tooth, but very good.

Supposedly 2010 Vintage but given the state of the bottle this looks very hard to believe  this far more likely the 2005 Vintage. 75 cl. bottle split by 2 @ Kulminator. Pours a reddish brown with white bubbles. Nose is very sweet, lots of raisins, candy, caramelized fruits, pure syrup, syrup de Liège, crazy amounts of candy sugar, thick malts, very thick caramel & toffee, nectarines, quite digging it but everyone else was appalled & found it far too sweet. It is probably a bit too much to do a lot of. Taste is caramel, toffee, lots of candy sugar, syrup de liege, touch oxidized, very sweet sugar, caramelized fruits, lots of caramelized raisins & apples, Grand Marnier cake, herbs, syrup de Liège, Light touches of oxidation body wise, thick, sugar rich. Quite a desert beer.

Bouteille verte de 750 ml obtenue via Importations Privées Bièropholie. Arôme: Odeur de caramel fruité avec une pointe dépices. Apparence: La couleur est brune avec une faible densité de bulle. Présence dun mince col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de caramel fruité avec une pointe dépices et de chocolat. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement vineuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût fruité. (Rating #4469)

75 cl bottle.
Originally rated on 20091205.
Pours amber color with a medium sized head. Aroma of malts, caramel, toffee, hints of licorice and earth notes. Flavor of malts, ripe fruits, mild spice notes, yeast, toffee, caramel and wooden notes. Excellent.

Bottle at Gainsbar. Dark red brown colour, small golden head. Aroma is sweet, caramel, bit beefy but mostly sweet. Taste nice sweet, sugar, beefy again, caramel. Very nice sweetness. not too full on, but decent body. Last beer of a long session so write up is all over the place.

Deep red brown with superb creamy head. Aroma is typical trappist quad, sweet and spicy, dark/dried fruits, figs, dates, raisin, sweet malt. Taste is the same, quite sweet. Medium carbo. Really good, well ballanced quad.

An interesting Trappist beer. Pours a dark thick red-brown, with light head. Smells of green apples. Tastes the same, almost to a cider level. Very sweet. Good, but couldn't have too much.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours almost black with frothy white head. Thick treacle flavour and aroma but misses the depth and complexity of some of its other trappist counterparts (eg rochefort, westvleteren)

75 cl bottle @ home, BBE 16.11.2012
Aroma has raisins, grainy notes and toffee typical to an aged Belgian ale. Flavour has lots of grain, some hay, chocolate, earthy notes, funky farmhouse feeling and distant cardboard notes. Alcohol is also on the background, but does not disturb. Palate is rather low on CO2. Good, although I expected more. Perhaps this is better fresh.

Bottle (750 ml). Reddish brown with almost no head but a lot of beige lacing. Theres a lot of fruits (dried fruits, cherry, raisins, berries) in the aroma along with nuts, spices and earthy notes. Taste is also fruity and nutty with spices and earthy/mineral notes. Mouthfeel is dry. Medium carbonation. Slight alcohol warming. Body is not too heavy but theres a lot of sweetness in there and almost too much fruits to make it easily drinkable.

Refrigerated 75 cl green bottle poured into a glass.  Pours chestnut brown with small beige head.  Little lacing, light body, little carbonation, and date aroma.  Taste is date, fig, some vinegar toward the finish, and some dark candy sugar.  Good.

Poured from a 750ml bottle into a trappist glass. Thanks for bringing this, weihenheizen! Pours a lighter colored brown, with a thin head of beige foam. The aroma has some vinegar and bleu cheese notes resting atop some sweet, fig and sherry type notes. The taste is kind of odd to me. I get the sweetness, but Im also having trouble getting past the acidic vinegar and cheese. Im about the only person in the group that tasted the cheese, so maybe Im crazy. The body is very light, especially for the style.

750 mL bottle. Pours a hazy plum with visible sediment and minimal bubbly head. Nose and flavor marked with fig, raisin, dry yeasty cinnamon raisin bread, beautiful rich Belgian spice character. Ridiculously drinkable for the ABV- crisp and dry, very well attenuated. Classic trappist quad.

Bottle from Beers Of Europe. It pours very dark brown, with a thick beige head. The nose is raisin, plum, prune, grape, vinous, marzipan, wood and earth. The taste is roasted malt, wood, raisin, plum, prune, marzipan, some underlying alcohol warmth, earth, wood, spice, some bitter chocolate, with a warming finish. Medium-full body and moderate carbonation. Complex, well balanced and pretty damn delicious.

A wonderful quad that in my eyes should be up there with W12. 
The fact that getting 4-5 74ml bottles isnt hard makes this beer even more wonderful.

Bottle sample.
Slightly hazy amber, small light head.
Fruity aroma, raisins, sweet malt, figs and caramel.
Sweet flavor, alcoholic, fruit cake and earthy tones.
Medium-full body, long finish, signs of age.
Caramel, herbs, brown foam, medium sweetness and bitterness, heavily sour, soft carbonation, sticky.

September 17, 2011 - at Against The Grain.  750ml bottle shared with my buddy Alan G.  Murky deep reddish brown pour with a large and lasting tan creamy head.  Aroma is medium dry red wine, alcohol, leather, solid yeast and sweet  and spicy caramel malt - classic Belgian brune.  Taste is the same, but a bit thin, earthy and boozy, dry background herbal/floral bitterness.  Average to light body, some yeast/spice astringency, light carbonation, and a sweet lush finish, dry and sort of gritty in the aftertaste - aging well, and a solid drink.

(Bottle, Chez Moeder Lambic Fontainas, Brussels, 21 July 2012) Reddish brown colour with frothy, beige head. Malty, fruity nose with notes of caramel, dried fruit, candy sugar and spices. Malty taste with caramel, dried fruit, raisins, brown sugar, prunes and a mild spicy bitterness in the finish. Almost full body, with a certain sweetness. Quite complex, tasty and very nice.

Dark amber color in the glass with a medium head. It has an aroma of caramel and roasted fruits and I detect some sweetness. Taste is sweet for a quad. Candy-like with caramel and licorice. There is also an apple cider taste to it. long finish.

Poured from a 75 cl bottle purchase at the abbey.  Opaque dark brown color with a thick frothy tan head. Lots of carbonation. Aroma of roasted malt, yeast and raisins. Dark red fruit, feint caramel, with the roast malt. Not too sweet   Somewhat bitter finish.  A very nice beer.
Bottle. Murky brown pour with a tan creamy head. Dark fruit, malty, and a dry finish. Solid quad.

A great sensation when the brew goes down. A scent that is very inviting and pleasant. An after taste that is in perfect combination with the entire experience. I intend to enjoy this relaxing beverage again.

Bottle, july 14th 2012.
Muddy brown color, thick beige head. Aroma of sweet malts, dried fruit, roasted malt, yeast. Taste is also sweet, with raisins, coffee, pepper, cherries, alcohol, syrup. Bitter and a bit sour finish, lasting warm taste.
0.75L bottle.  Extra-strong aroma for an extra-strong beer.  Super pleasant, a little sour, but bruin maltyness as well.  Easy to drink, tastes a little like flowers.

750ml bottle. Pours a dark brown computed beer with a small head head. Alcoholic, malty aroma, some  fruits detected. Flavors like cherries and alcohol and a good malty sweetness. Overall quite sweet could have been more but still a good beer.

Pours a dark brown-small laced head, very fruity aroma which reminded me of cherry, is applicable for the taste as well. Dont really feel the alcohol % from the taste. Quite a nice beer to keep drinking

750ml bottle at Staminee de Garre

Pours a hazy brown color with a good tight head and nice lacing on the glass. 

The aroma is nutty and rich. The level of spice is moderate and is limited to darker richer spice characters like anise and cinnamon. Some sweet plum aromas are evident. 

The flavor is rich with some mild toffee with lots of nuttiness. The beer is plenty sweet and a tad bit boozy. Some dark fruit is present but not nearly as pronounced as perhaps I had expected. 

I loved this beer and would have written much more, but a Flemish gentleman who hardly spoke English was sitting at the table next to me and kept trying to get me to trade beers with him. He apparently really liked Achel. I decided to be social rather than hand scralling a whole bunch of notes about plum cake and burnt sugar. boo hoo.

Bouteille de 750ml. Bière brune-noisette avec une mince couche de mousse. Au nez les arômes sont intenses de fruits secs, prunes et noisette. Il y a une touche chocolaté qui augmente le plaisir. En bouche la bière est surprenante de sa digestibilité. Elle est facile à boire. Les saveurs de noix et de fruits secs sont bien présent. La finale est bien atténuée ce qui la rend encore plus digeste. Une superbe bière. 8/10

Pours medium brown, moderate but fast disappearing head, soft carbonation. Taste is sweet malt with hints of carmel, yeast, alcohol. Not very complex, and not very interesting. More like a dubbel or a Belgian strong ale. Fairly balanced. Finishes sweet with a touch of bitterness. Not very impressive. I would opt for others in this style over this.
Dark brown color with fine brown lacewing head. Caramel and malt aroma. Sweet warming alhohol and malty.

(75 cl)  Une petite tête foncée qui flotte sur une robe plutôt brunâtre.  Un premier nez de petits fruits et, notamment, de cerises bien appétissantes.  Une seconde vague qui apporte des parfums maltés et des épices à la belge.  Un alcool en sourdine, véritablement.  Des saveurs douces et légèrement surettes, des malts caramélisés et une levure relevée avec un alcool jamais chaud mais légèrement amer.  Une bouche qui évite la corpulence.  Elle est toutefois bien structurée, de moyenne densité, avec des bulles assez molles et une texture plutôt crémeuse.  Une finale qui permet à un concerto fruité de se faire entendre à travers le souffle plutôt tiède dun alcool accompagnateur dune tranquille amertume de houblons.  Une quadruple très intéressante par ses flaveurs et facile à boire par son intelligente constitution.  En conclusion, très bon mais aucunement renversant.

Bouteille 750ml, dégustée en compagnie de SlovakSniper. De couleur brune foncée et voilée. Nez de levures fruitées (prunes, moyen de raisins, traces de figues et de cerises) aux notes épicées (notes de clou de girofle, traces de poivre), de pain, moyen-léger de sucre brun avec des notes de toffee, de chocolat noir, dalcool et de houblon herbeux. Ronde-moyenne en bouche avec un pétillement moyen et  une texture léger-mpoyen crémeuse et aux faibles notes liquoreuses. Goût de levures fruitées (prunes rouges et noires, léger de raisins, notes de cerises, traces de figues) aux notes épicées (clou de girofle, traces de poivre doux) lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute rapidement un goût caramel toffee doux avec un moyen goût de pain, des notes de sucre brun et des traces de chocolat noir. Parallèlement, lon retrouve un léger goût dalcool doux et réchauffant jusquen où sy retrouve également des petites notes amères de houblon herbeux (traces florales). Post-goût long, moyen-léger amer dalcool doux avec un goût de levures fruitées (moût de petits fruits foncés, notes de pelures de prunes).

Pours a muddy brown with a creamy head with ample lacing; brwon sugar and molasses cookie aromas; nice creamy mouthfeel... sweet up front then tart and then slight alcohol burn.. tart/sour flavor lingers on and for that, the beer is not great for me.

Cloudy brown with a light tan head. Grape aromatics along with fresh apple. Full bodied, fresh tasting quad. Fruity mid palate with apples and just a hint of earth. Esters appear on the finish. Great beer.

750mL from Conn Ave. Pours clear amber to deep mahogany. Medium to smaller beige head requires coaxing. Webby, near complete lace. Okay retention. Nose is heavy dark fruits, mulled cider, candied tamarind, holiday spices. Taste is rich, silky, milk chocolate, tangy citrus background, mild lemon sweet tea. Also a mulled red wine character comes through with silky ganache. A lighter fruit background persists with tangerine and citrus tea. Interesting. No medicinal or boozy character. Not really estery in the nose. No soap or metals in the palate. Pretty nice if not a bit too neutral. Carbonation is lower. Alcohol comes through after a few big gulps. Nice dessert beer. Not my favorite for the style.

UPDATED: MAY 31, 2012 From a 75cl bottle, courtesy of Muggins. Gushed, so poured a murky brown colour, the only disappointment! Aroma is lovely, sweetish alcholic fruit. Taste is very full, lots of dried fruit (fruit cake?), malt, spicy Belgian hopping. Long, sweetish, perhaps a touch boozy, finish. Excellent.

75 cl bottle bb date 2014, pours dark brown with a minimal head, aroma of malt, dark fruit, yeast and cane sugar, taste follows the nose, very low carbonation, remiscent of rochefort, fairly smooth despite the low carbonation, enjoyable overall.

Pours hazy brown with a large off white head.  Nose is bready, with dark fruits and light spice as well as light floral notes.  Taste is sweet, with a well balanced bitter presence that continues to be balances through the finish.  Mouthfeel is crisp and clean, medium to full body with a long aftertaste.

Dark brown, cocacolaish with nice generous head. Aroma fruit, malt, hops, some metallic. Taste sweet candy malt, dark fruits. Alcohol well hidden. Medium body. Very smooth. Finish with warming alcohol and sweetness.
Bottle @HomeMurky brown, nice beige head. Tasty quadruple with overripe fruit, bit portlike taste. Body might have been a bit fuller. Nice soft carbonation.

75 cL bottle from Beers of Europe served into a Westmalle glass.  Creamy head over dark red brown beer.  Complex, creamy, boozy, dried fruit aroma.  Sweet, with some bitterness, and lots of other flavours together.  Fruity, a little sourness.  A satisfying beer and worth drinking, but just a little short of true excellence.

28/11/2012 Bir&Fud Bottega (750ml bottle). Bruna, intensa, riflessi color caffè, quasi impenetrabile, schiuma finissima, non molto abbondante e poco persistente. Al naso sentori dolciastri, zucchero di canna, canditi, uva passa, malto, lieviti, molto speziati. In bocca ha un attacco dolce, molto morbido, zuccherosa, leggermente caramellosa, ma al palato scivola via che è una bellezza, bevibilità assoluta, forse manca solo un po di amaro nel finale. Vellutata, corpo medio, carbonazione soft. Magnifica birra.

bottle  pours very dark brown with full might brown head that lingers . Aromas of malts , caramels , bread , and dark ripe fruits . good body and quite full carbonation to handle the strength . Taste is malty sweet to start then a nice slightly sour dark cherry taste comes in on top with a hint of hop bitterness .  Some pleasant alcohol warmth in the aftertaste . A good beer for sure .

Over-ripened fruits, plums, prunes and raisins. Sweet up front, but a little spicy in the finish. Alcohol flavors in the aftertaste. Moderate bitterness, medium bodied with moderately high carbonation.

UPDATED: AUG 20, 2012 poured from bottle into a chalice. Pours a nice light brown color that is somewhat see-through.

balanced with a real savory quality and aromas of malts, caramel, some grains and a touch of dark cherries.

this brings the kind of feel that only a trappist ale can bring. Very smooth and extremely balanced with good flavors of malts, caramel and dark cherries. The flavors arent as pronounced as I would want, but they are still extremely good.

This is a real quality trappist ale. Great balance on the smell and feel, but maybe lacking a slight bit in complexity. Nevertheless, this is a real good beer and one that is very enjoyable.

Clear dark brown colour -except the last pour, obviously-, fluffy but not very big beige head. Aroma of dark malts, raisins, chocolate, caramel and brown sugar. Flavour of sweet malts, slight brown sugar, raisins, light sour berries, light roasted malt bitterness, light dark chocolate. Very full body, thick and slighly sticky. Long fruity finish, dancing around in your mouth. Caramel and raisins topped with some warming alcohol, like a christmas cake. Really nice.
(From -matured- 75cL bottle @ Café Jos, Nijmegen)

UPDATED: NOV 19, 2012 aroma: floral, caramel, 
apparenza: orange, hazy, 
gusto: medium sweetness, 
palato: full body, creamy, long finish, soft carbonation, 
tutti dovrebbero provarla,birra che vorrei avere sempre di scorta. laroma floreale e il sapore dolce e alcolico allo stesso tempo la rendono unica. la migliore achel senza dubbio.

750 ml bottle. BBE 09/2014.
Pours a deep, quite dirty-like brown colour with a small white head. Aroma of sweet caramel, raisins and suryp. Flavour of toasted malts, sweet caramel, raisins, syrup and light spices. Full bodied, thick and somewhat sticky mouthfeel with a long, warming, fruity finish. Extremely well balanced.

750ml bottle from Bierzwerg
BBE 1.9.2013 or 2014 - Pours dark brown with a foamy white head. Aroma of exotic fruits, plum, raisins and caramel malts. Taste is quite malty and fruity with notes of raisin, plum and spices. Finish is quite fruity and full bodied. Tasty, well balanced quadrupel. Nice one.

Bottled 75cl. Icelandic moss throughout. Malty, yeasty and sweet. Rather dissapointing to my tastes.

Tastes very smooth with dark layers of plum and grapes. Medium to low carbonation allows for flavors to come through way better. no heat at all,  pours a slightly deep copper with a slight tan head that holds throughout sipping session. I was really impressed by this one
Pitch dark brown body with an off white head. Strong malty aroma with coffee, chocolate, some melon, dry and balanced. Amazing sweet flavour with chocolate, coffee and licorice.

Bottled. A hazy brown beer with a tan head. Aroma is malty, sweet, yeasty notes, caramel. Taste is also malty and sweet, spicy, caramel, burnt sugar, dark fruits and alcohol. Full body and high carbonation. Nice texture. Great beer

Huge, copper-colored, bottle-conditioned ale, a very satisfying beer, with just a little malt sweetness, dried fruit flavors, warm sherry notes, and a brisk balancing backdrop of fresh hop bitterness.

75cl bottle. Aroma is loads of malt, caramel and spice.
Flavour is quite sweet, malty caramel, some spices.
Not bad but a bit tired of these standard belgians.r

Bottle. Clear dark brown pour, thin off-white head. Aroma is full of ripe fruit, plum, raisins, alcohol and madeira. Flavor is sweet sugary fruity malts, some alcoholic warmth, slightly spicy in the finish. Nice brew.

Pours a cloudy dark brown color.  Aroma is of malts, dark fruit, fig, resin, and yeast.  Flavor is similar.  Theres a nice sweetnes to this.  Sweeter malts, and brown sugar really comes through.  Nice sweeter malt finish.  Good quad/brown ale.

750 mL bottle from Beers of the World in Rochester NY, served in a branded Trappist glass. Pours clear mahogany with a small tan head that slowly fades to a thin cover and leaves a small amount of fine lace. The nose has notes of caramel, raisins, candi sugar, figs, yeast and a touch of floral hops. The flavour is quite sweet with a rich, complex malt profile. Lots of brown sugar, caramel, raisins and figs come through, along with a subtle hint of dry sherry. There are touches of earth and herbal hops throughout. The finish is long and malty with molasses notes. On the palate, it is medium-full in body with a smooth, syrupy texture and soft carbonation. Overall, this is a nice quadrupel, but not quite at the level of Westvleteren 12 or Rochefort 10. It is a bit sweet for my taste and the malts are rather simple for a quad. It also could have been more full on the palate. 2011-12-02

750ml bottle at BarVolo. Dont think my server noticed but the bottle was expired. Definitely not complaining! Well aged... pours copper brown with a very thin beige head with mild lacing. Aroma is extremely malty, with some yeast caramel fruit and minimal hops. Flavour is sweet with notes of dark fruit and malts. Overall Exceptional.

Bottle @ Bir&fud bottega  (where its the #1 beer at the moment) brown/wood/Monk tunic color, dirty white head quick to disappear. Intense aroma of dried fruits, yeast, malt, caramel, cereals. Taste of grapes, a little bit chocolate, malt, raisins, spices, pear. I think due its complexity, you might find tons of different flavors in it. Perfectly, and i mean it, balanced. It warms, but the alcohol is well hidden imo; no booziness. Medium body, velvet mouthfeel. surprising bitter finish, the beer has a lot of sweetness anyway. If i have to find one defect, the achel extra is too winey but who cares in (just) this case. Last time i had this one was 3 years ago after a long drinking session and it had been resulted very intense and hard to drink, with a lot of booziness. This time the story has been totally different, and the achel was incredible enjoyable
Muddy brown in appearance.  A bit of skunk on the aroma.  Tastes a bit off... sort of like a foot.. A decent quad.  nothing more.

Bottle split with mcberko. Pours a solid black with a small white head. Aroma of dark fruits, candied fruits, booze and apples. Flavour of dark fruits, candied fruits, booze, raisins, grape, black currant and booze. Smooth and full bodied.

7th August 2011Dean Swift - RBESG Tasting. 10.0% abv. Cloudy amber beer, small off white head. Light frothy palate. Sweetish caramel with a little toffee. Wheaty malt as well. Tastes slighty aged. Ok though.

2 x 10 cl. samples from 75 cl. bottles. Dark, red-brown colour with a big, tanned head. Aroma is quite spicy, with some caramel, dark prunes, and brown sugar. Some bitterness at the long lasting finish seems to be hops rather than alcohol based. Full bodied with soft carbonation. The alcohol is actually very well hidden. Achel Extra Bruin is an excellent beer.

UPDATED: OCT 14, 2011 Pours brown-to-dark-brown with a tan head.  Aroma is of huge cherry and spicy/bakers yeast.  Flavor is dark cherry, some blueberry, dates, spiced raisin syrup, light caramel malt, boozy and fine.  Light-to-medium body.  I really wish I could have tasted it side-by-side with the normal brune.  After it is given a lot of time to warm up and breath I get more booziness and a lovely bready flavor that reminds me of Pascha, a Slavik Easter bread, and this taste lingers wonderfully.

Awsome Im the 500th Rater of this brew. Brown almost coke looking pour. Sediment was more than normal. Aroma was sweet and of dried fruit. Very easy to drink and has a balanced flavor which isnt too sweet and has a great aftertaste. Alcohol is hidden exceptionally. Great Beer.

750mL bottle, split 3 ways, pours a reddish dark brown with a small beige head. Aroma of black currants, raisins, grape and brown sugar. Flavour features the grape and raisins prominently, with black currants, sweet caramel and brown sugar. Sweet, but not cloying and quite complex. Very well-made - too bad this is not easy at all to find like Rochefort 10 or St. Bernardus Abt. 12.

Bottle 75cl. Murky reddish beer with off white and creamy head that very soon dissapear. Aroma to toasted malt, dry fruits, nut, almond, honey. Taste of caramel and toaste malts. On palate some wine and alcoholic hints but the balance is really good.

0.75l bottle. My first Achel beer ever, and Ive got a feeling this is going to be quite a nice one. I pour it over into my Chimay glass (yeah I know. Its like the Pet Shop Boys say, "Its a sin", but I dont have a Achel glass) and it pours a un-transparent dark woody and nutty-brown body with quite a few big beige sediments and a fading bubbly and somewhat sidesticking creamy light tanned head. The aroma is light sweet with notes of dark sugar, apples, plums and some mild hints of chocolate malts and some warming alcohol. Not the most extreme aroma, but quite nice. Its average to softly carbonated, quite full-bodied and it has a mild, smooth and light sticky mouthfeel. When tasting it I get lots of dark candy sugar, sweet fruits, wet autumn leafs before the finish gives a nice little warming alcohol punch. A really nice beer that Im looking forward to trying again one day (and I know that day will come soon)
Bottled, pours a nice foamy head, lots of alcohol up front, pretty bitter, lots of dates and dark fruits, tasty stuff

Tipica de navidad.
Aromas a chocolate,malta caramelizada,levadura  y alcohol.
Fuerte sabor a caramelo con  final amargo.
Muy buena para el frio.

UPDATED: SEP 1, 2011 (750ml)  Sippin on a 750ml of this on some random ass Monday night ...living the good life ...nose is abundant a    deep malt richness showcased , almonds , hazelnuts, raisins  ..musty undertones...  Toasted malt flavours , with pleasant  dark fruit notes . raisiny ... syrupy  ,yet not cloying in one skillful twist  . A    refined expereince  .
Bottle at Cafe Buitenlust, Oirschot. Brown color, off-white head. Smell malts, chocolate and nuts. Taste sweet, caramel, malts and raisin. Nice carbo and body.

750mL bottle.  Pours clear but chunky mahogany brown with with a persistent off-white head.  Aromas of dark fruit, fortified wine, roast, dark chocolate and alcohol.  Medium sweetness, mild bitterness, medium sourness, fruity, a bit of caramel, slightly roasty, a little chocolate.  Medium bodied, average carbonation, fairly sweet and quite sour finish.

Finally got hold of this missing piece in my Trappist collection from the Etre Gourmet webshop. :-) Pours a murky nut brown body with a big off-white head. Aroma is nuts, nougat, deep malts and hints of milk chocolate. Taste is milk chocolate, strong nougaty tones reminiscent of yet another Norwegian bread spread from my childhood which I suspect is long gone now: "Nøtte". :-) Caramel and raisins, which is to be expected. Moderate boozy hints to propel the flavors into position, followed by a creamy and full mouthfeel to make for a great exper this is a well-balanced beer indeed. A bit sweet, a bit different, but very good. Achel certainly proves its place among the Trappist breweries with this original take on the quad genre.
Hazy dark amber with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, dried fruit, yeasty and dark sugar. Flavor is very sweet and light bitter. Sweet finish with warming alcohol. 020711
Bottle. Hazy dark brown/orange with small tan head. Flavour is malt, yeast, dark fruits, caramel, hops, little bitter, little rip fruit and a little sweet.
Nice and brown looking colour. Tastes a bit sweet, fruity. Little bit bitter, which is a good thing.

Pours like my cowboy coffee with a tall head that lingers. It gently simmers down to a fluffy ring and a clump that lay stubborn like a dead muledeer. Smells of dried stonefruit, dusty granite boulders, and bakers cocoa. Medium nectar weight and light on the tongue with gentle yet ample effers, almost oily in texture. Excellent aroma to flavor follow through adding that the bitter cocoa is prominent. Throw in some roasted coffee bean, a twist of citric acid and a defined bitterness on the finish. The acidity keeps me thirsty and the high octane keeps me warm on the trail.

Aromatisch malzig-süßer Antrunk mit leichter Alkoholnote, die aber eher unterstützend als negativ auffällt. Würzig-vollmundig, leicht schokoladig. Im großen und ganzen angenehm trinkbar, angenehm würzig und leicht kräuterartig, nicht übermäßig stark. Angenehm, beinahe süffig. Danke an den Doppelbock für das Bier! /11/11/11/11/11

Really good stuff.  Dark malty fruits.  Lots of alcohol in the nose and the flavors.  rich palate.  This should be held in higher reguard.  Finish shows lots of Belgium charater.  Sweetness malt with a decent balance of hops in a Quad Bel style.
Very subtle, I was expecting a big strong beer here, and its not the case at all. Delicious belgian flavors. Very complex.

750ml bottle from Bruery Provisions).  Pours hazy mahogany with a khaki head.  Aroma has candied sugar, dried pit fruit (apricot and date-maybe some fig).  Taste is sweet with the fruit and candied sugar even stronger than the nose.  Thin to medium bodied with a slick texture.  Smooth, sweet finish.  This beer borders on being cloyingly sweet, but just before it falls off the cliff, it comes back with some light wine notes and some acidity.  A very good beer.

Bottled shared with Amyliz4. Served in a Mikasa goblet.

Pours a brownish-red color with a good off-white head and quite a bit of initial lacing. The head is fairly stable with pretty good retention. Eventually this falls into a thin collar and a cap comprised of a few bubbles. The nose is really nice and sweet at cellar temperature with plenty of dark fruits, toffee, and some dates. Caramel-like sweetness abounds.

The flavor is a bit more mellow and subdued. There is a bit of bitterness and the sweetness isnt nearly as strong. There are some dark fruits and a bit of a toffee presence, but not like what I was finding in the nose. Not nearly as complex, but still quite good. Bitterness is a bit out of place. Slight bitterness mixing with the alcohol is a bit strange, but I can work with it. Low carbonation and a medium body. Overall, a pretty tasty beer and Im glad to finally try a bottle of this.

Bottled, 750ml from La Cave de LEstam, Verdun, France. Opaque copper with white head. Particularly sweet maltiness to start, quite candied and really pretty fruity, smooth and full. There is a wine like character with this, soft carbonation with big alcohol notes. Heavy in the close. Big stuff.

10/04/2011 75cl bottle @ parents home  (2011-142) 
Little cloudy brown beer, light beige small head, unstable and adhesive. Aroma: chocolate, ripe red fruits, some caramel. MF: good carbon, full body. Taste: caramel, chocolate, some hop bitters, sour berries just like the normal Bruin, raisins. Aftertaste: little dry, sour red berries, caramel.

750ml capped bottle, best by April 2009.  Lets see how this holds up 2 years after the best by date and being on a store shelf almost the entire time.  Pours murky reddish-brown with a short-lived one finger tan head leaving a few spots of lacing and holding not much more than a ring.  Aroma is smooth dark fruits, raisins, plums, figs, Belgian candi sugar, bread and yeast, like jam-slathered toasted bread.  Good strength.  Flavor is more dark fruits, raisins, red grapes, plums, figs, candi/brown sugar, rather sweet, very smooth, no alcohol noticed.  Mouthfeel is medium bodied, low carbonation.  Damned good Abt/Quad even two years past its prime according to the brewers.  For the money though, Im more likely to pick up another bottle of St. Bernardus Abt 12 over this in the future.

750ml green capped bottle.

Pours into my tulip with a fizzy, billowing slightly off-white head. The beer is a hazy brown/amber/reddish brown.

The yeast is very powerful n the scent with hints of lemon. There is also some dark fruit scents like red grape, raisin, and prune. And also some hints of dark malts and caramel.

The taste is actually very similar to the smell. It is more astringent than most Belgian strong darks. There are a bit more spices in the flavor and I am definitely picking up some cinnamon-like character. It has just a bit of tartness which is welcome for this style. After the sediment is poured the tartness vanishes and loads of caramel and yeast goodness come to the forefront. It is one damn complex brew.

The mouthfeel is a bit too carbonated, that is the only real flaw of this beer.

Overall it is a great Trappist beer, I expected better but this is pretty good.

Bottle 75cl. A dark beer with good head and lacing. Smell is on spices and barley sugar. Aroma is sweet, creamy, malty with nice coriander and cinnamon aroma, brown candy sugar. Good body with slightly vinous notes, intense caramel flavor that remain on aftertaste. Alcohol is well hidden, the beer is easy drinkable, properly balanced, near to Westmalle dubble. Fruit notes are on prune at the beginning and dry grapes at the finish. Good beer with some champagne yeast aftertaste.

(bottle) pours a murky brownish ruby colour with a quickly diminishing white head. aroma of pears, candied sugar and banana, with light hints of earth. flavour is yeasty, with light notes of caramel and bread dough, quite inexpressive and dominated by a huge cloying sweetness. heavy-bodied and alcoholic, with aggressive carbonation.
Light butterscotch aroma. Brown color, beige head, good lace. Very sweet, butterscotch, light spices, hopbitter, full, smooth. Very nice but not exceptional.

Bottled 750ml. -Dark amber/brown coloured, medium sized pale brown head, fruity caramel nose. Sweet malty, dried fruits and caramel with notes of candy sugar. Mild presence of alcohol in the finish. Enjoyable brew.
Bomber. Pours red with quarter inch cream head. Aroma is yeast and cherry. Flavor is sweet cherry and plum with noticeable yeastiness. Finish has some cherry sourness. Very nice.
Pours a slightly cloudy dark amber.  Taste is of caramel, malt, and toffee.  Blooms gracefully into a warm, slightl;y bitter alcohol finish.  Very good.

Dark brown pour with thick off white head.  Aroma of belgian yeast, fruity esters,  caramel, toffee, brown sugar.  A bit of spice.  Flavor is fruity, caramelly, balanced, just perfectly belgian.  Really refined and excellent, one of the best tasting trappist beers Ive had, which is saying a lot.  This is an Awesome beer.

Bottle. Dirty mahogany with a beige head that fades to a coat. Aroma of hazelnuts, chestnuts, amontillado sherry, dried wild figs, earth. Tastes sweet and very nutty with big muddying earthy yeast and hop bitterness struggling to dry things out. Perhaps the flavours would clarify with some age, but this ones a bit flabby.

750ml from IPB.
Appearance : Hazy dark amber with no head.

Aroma : Mineral and earthy. Light raisins and dark fruits. Nutty with spices. Light liquorice.

Taste : Yeast and dark fruits. Light caramel with some spices. Nutty and spicy. Warm finish, quite spicy. Flat carbonation.

Overall : Not bad. Great nose. Nice nutty notes. Nice dark fruits and raisins. Palate a bit too flat. Nothing to write home about.

Easily the best by Achel. Reminds me a lot of St. Bernardus 12, but way better. Not that muddy taste and look. Would definitely like to try an aged bottle of this to see how it holds up, could be amazing possibly.

Poured a dark ruby with a light tan head. Nose of caramel malts and spices. Medium body.  Smooth mouthfeel.  Flavor is dominated by the caramel sweet with dried fruit.  Bitterness on top of sweetness makes a great finish. Superb ale.

Bottle:
Airy off white foamy head on top of a clear deep dark amber brown beer.

Soft mouthfeel and low carbo.

text: bottle.... Light brown pour , medium beige head , minimal lace . Aroma of sweet malt , fruit and yeast . Flavor is sweet , notes of plum ,raisins , marzipan and yeast . Creamy mouthfeel , medium bodied . Finish is sweet . Alcohol is barely present .

Bottle pours brown root beer color with thick foamy off-white head that recedes quickly.  Aroma dark fruits and malts.  taste quite nice with raisins, plums, dark fruits, spices, malts.  Finish clean with essentially no hops.  Acts like it will become bitter but quickly fades.  Palate thick but not syrupy, well carbonated.  Alcohol not detectable.

I agree this quad is a step below the greats, but still pretty damn good.

750 ml bottle.  Pours a dark brown with a small tan head leaving a small amount of lacing on the glass.  Decent amount of floating yeast.  Aroma is strong of yeast, dark fruit, raisins, and light alcohol.  Initial taste is sweet caramel transitioning into bready yeast.  Warm alcohol on the finish.  Medium body.  Light carbonation.

Pours a clear dark golden brown with an enormous white head composed or large bubbles and craters.  The head takes quite a while to go down.  This beer smells like beer.  Descriptive, I know, but its true.  Sweet malt and nutmeg with dark fruit.  This beer is smooth in the mouth and easy to drink.

UPDATED: JAN 29, 2012 6 year old bottle. 
Glowing, clear, orange-red-amber with just a bit of lace. 
Slightly oxidized aroma. Some hops, alcohol, caramel, chocolate, dried fruits. Flavor is Caramel, fruits, a touch of cheese. 
Soft body, amazingly smooth. This has held up and aged wonderfully. 

(old 3.8 rating) Big caramel aroma with raisins, plums. Rich flavor, with some port and a bit of oxidation along with plums, raisins, caramel.. Smooth and rounded, very nice. I would put it a step below Rochefort or Westy, but still a very nice abt.

Bottle. Small, rapidly diminishing to sparse, light brown head over a hazy red-brown body. Aroma-taste: currants/raisins, spices with a balanced body and a chocolatey bitter finish. Medium bodied. Modest carbonation.
Very dark brown appearance with some ruby highlights. Not my best....................

750 mL bottle from Soho Organic Market in Elizabeth City.  Muddy brown pour.  Earthy aroma of grass and soil.  Huge sweet Belgian candi sugar flavor.  A considerable amount of alochol warmth.  This is not bad but a bit too sweet for my liking.

The aroma for me has hints of acid, cherries and other fruit.
Really sweet flavours, with a bit of vinegar. Not too fond of the immense sweetness. Mingling are raisins, brown sugar. 
Alright, but not my favourite.

Dark amber/cider color with light particles; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of sweet malt, yeast, caramel, dark fruit, & rich spice; Flavor of sweet malt, yeast, dark fruit (notably plums & dates), caramel, raisons, and spice; Nicely balanced and complex; The alcohol is fairly well hidden; Overall, well done - great brew.
Bottle. Dark Amber with a bit of fizz. Dark fruits (raisin, plum and berry) with spices (pepper and clove) and roasty malts. Complex and rich. deceptively rich with suble well masked alchohol.

Bottle. Murky brown pour, a bit of white head. Aroma of belgian yeast, brown sugar, cherries, malt and a hint of alcohol. Taste is quite sweet, almost cloying, berries, malt and sugar come through. Palate is very nice, medium carbonation, slightly creamy. Good quad.

Murky brown with a thin, sudsy off-white head; a bit of sediment.  Sweet, roasty aroma.  Light mouth feel but a plesant moderately sweet beer; nice chocolatey roast tones and light fruit notes.  Really excellent and note overdone in any area.

Bottle from Consumer Beverages. Pours dark brown with a nice tan head, and good lace; Aroma of sweet roasted malt and dried fruit ; Flavour is sweet malt, figs and caramel, spice, very slight bitter with noticeable alcohol ; Lingering aftertaste

Wanted to taste this beer together with a friend... Today I bought it, and after the 30 minutes drive home, i heard the bottle was open... So had to taste it now... cause I hate beer with a loack of carbonation. Pours out very dark brown, big beige head that holds good. Sticks nice to the glass. Fruity, earthy smell, lightly sweetness-sourness and spiced, some caramel inside. Not bad at all. NIce balanced taste between biterness, sweetness and sourness. The sweetness comes up first, to change to the lightly sourness, and a moderated biterness comes up. To sad I cant share this bottle with a friend anymore, but thats more for me :) Pretty good quadrupel in my opinion.

Bottle from Utobeer market stall. Brown pour with a beige head.Aromas of caramel, toffee, raisins, some butterscotch.  Nice, robust flavours of brown sugar, ripe plums, damsons, sweet spices and chocolate. Malty, sweet finish. Good stuff.

Bottle.

A - Dark and cloudy mahogany and chestnut brown with a bit of a dark red hue and a good amount of yeast floating. Smaller than average tight, foamy head that settles pretty fast into a thin foamy lace that concentrates on one side.

S - Burnt brown sugar and molasses along with some caramel malt sweetness. Some dark and dried fruit covering all kinds of dark fruit. Some earthy, nutty and cocoa aroma comes out in the background. Some spices and yeast present, but not overly strong.

T - Similar to the nose. Strong burnt brown sugar and molasses sweetness along with some caramel malt. Dark fruit was present, but not dominant, or all that strong given the style. Mid sip brings some earthy and herbal bitterness along with a good amount of nutty and earthy flavors. Also touches of cocoa in the background. Sweet earthy nuttiness comes out stronger toward the finish. Just faint spiced and yeast flavor.

M - Medium body with a bit below average carbonation. Fairly creamy and smooth.

D - Very drinkable with some sweetness and very smooth and creamy. Nice mix of sweeter malt and earthy/nutty flavor. Very easy to drink beer.

Notes: Best before 16/07/11. Very enjoyable beer with good subtle flavors and a good amount of sweet nutty and earthy flavors. Dark fruit isnt as strong as others in the style, but is present. Very enjoyable beer to drink. Definitely worth getting.
Older vintage that may have been past its prime. Pours a muddy brown. Nose is caramel, sugar, brown sugar and molasses. Taste is similar with malts and complex sweetness.

2005 vintage
head: normal
colour: amber/red/brown
smell: dairy , alcohol, spices , salt Liquorice , yeast 
taste: strong start , anis and spiced mouthfeel, ends minty/Liquorice like with some bitterness very special taste but o so good !

Taster at DØE meeting, Aarhus Syd, DK.
Bottled, 210410.
Brown with white head. Aroma of dark malt with some dried fruit. Flavor is caramel, cane sugar and hop spices.

One taste and this was instantly my current favorite beer. I love Trappists and this one beats them all (never tried the Wes...velten sp?).

The dry fruity aroma sucks you in then you take a taste. It starts sweet and lightly fruity and just the tiniest hint of licorice, then warms with a bit of sherry and 9.5 abv up on its way down. Finally, after a few seconds, you get the very mild hop bitterness to perfectly counter all the maltiness.

Mouthfeel is exactly what you expect from a Belgian Trappist. Bubbly and long.

UPDATED: APR 19, 2011 75cl bottle Pours a hazy red darkbrown color with a big beige head.  Aroma is very fruity with dried fruits, fine malt, nuts and caramel. Taste is sweet with malts, caramel, dried fruits, raisins, mild earthy notes and a slight bitterness. The mouthfeel is very soft and smooth and the drinkability is superb.  A very nice quadrupel that even comes close to the Rochefort 10 and Westvleteren 12. Superb!

Medium cloudy brown.  Aroma of yeast/esters.  Slightly doughy with some nuttiness and a background of various fruits and dark sugar.  A touch sweet.  Not much bitterness.  Flavorful from refrigerator all the way to room temp.  Great stuff.

Best by 11/2009. Dark mahogany, nice beige head but it goes to a ring quickly. Heavy yeast and plum in the nose, some light rye. Flavor is heavy yeast and fruit, lots of plum and cherry with some minor alcohol. Carbonation is way high and yeast too much at this point, finish is rich bread. Not bad, the finish being nicely controlled, but the front-end is too rough, even at this age.
Bottle. Pours dark, hazy amber with off-white rocky head. Palate is full bodied. Complex aromas have caramel, spices, roasted malt, floral notes, fruits.

$17 750mL green bottle from PP bottle shop.  I think this bottle has been light struck.  It would be nice if they switched to brown glass.  It could be the use of Saaz hops, but I doubt it.  Pours with a nice thick lasting head.  Dark brown amber color.  Illusion of sweetness, but dry.  Stronger Belgian yeast phenolics/higher alcohols.  Good, but I find it hard to drink.

Sampled at Auberge Douceurs Belges in Quebec City, September 2005. Poured a deep mohagoney with a good creamy head. A 3mm coat stays on the top of the brew and sediments falls to the bottom of the glass. Mild aromas of raisins and nuts. Creamy mouthfeel and very, very smooth. Alcohol is hardly present in the taste, just raisins with slight nuts. A very nice smooth trappist brew.

(bottle, 75cl) Cloudy, mahogany colour with a big tanned foamy head. Yeasty, moderately sweet toast-malty and buttery aroma with notes of caramel and distinctive notes of hazel- and walnuts. Sweet and slightly toasty bitter flavour, full bodied with a smooth and creamy mouthfeel. Deeply malty taste with a cornucopia of flavours; nutty and buttery caramelly taste with a tinge of candy, leading into a sweet and shy roasty bitter finish. An aromatic and complex surprise.

Has an aroma of fruit and caramel, with a hint of hops and cider.  Pours a chocolate brown haze with a generous head.  Has a sweet, yeasty flavor.  Notes of bubblegum.  The carbonation level seems perfect for the flavors.  Gives it a sharper feel and keeps it from becoming too doughy.  A pretty tasty brew.

Bottle. Pours dark reddish brown hazy with suspended yeast  creating a great murky appearance. The aroma is a mixture of candi sugar, raisin, and basement aromas. Tastes fairly sweet and slightly sour with a dry finish.

Bottle: Hazy, reddish-amber coloured, bigger slowly collapsing off-white head; solid & complex aroma: toffee, walnut-oil, butter, nuts and alcohol; solid sweet-bitter flavour, full bodied; nutty-almondy finish with a nice balancing bitterness in the aftertaste. What a big surprise.........

( 750ml bottle best by 9-07 thanks to BA bosse) This is obviously quite old as its expired already.

Pours very murky orange-brown with light film of bubbles. Nose of metal, rum raisins and bread. Taste of metal, oxidation, sweet bread, dark fruits, a little gritty but nice and well hidden alcohol.

Would love to try this again with only a year or so on it.

750 mL bottle pours rich mahogany with zero retaining head into a chalice; nice, delicate lacing.  Aroma of bready malts, brown sugar, cider, pear, raisin, nutmeg.  Starts smooth with delicate bready malts, pear, raisin, blends into spiced cider and brown sugar.  Apple pie and noticeable booze in the finish.  Becomes increasingly boozy and spicy with a peach like sweetness as it warms.  Pillowy mouthfeel with medium body and low-medium carbonation level.  Way too thin for the style.
